title: When It Comes to Jeffrey Epstein, Trump Says He Is Ready to Defer to the Courts
summary: After months of pushing back against federal judges and the courts, the president has requested the release of Epstein-related grand jury testimony to be “subject to Court approval.”

title: Justice Dept. Asks Manhattan Court to Unseal Epstein Grand Jury Testimony
summary: The president has been under intense political pressure from his base after Attorney General Pam Bondi withheld portions of investigative files on the disgraced financier.

title: In Response to Epstein Letter Report, Trump Says He Doesn’t ‘Draw Pictures’
summary: The president disputes reporting from The Wall Street Journal that he drew a picture for Jeffrey Epstein, but as a real estate mogul, he often sketched for charity.

title: Prisoner Swap Frees Americans in Venezuela for Migrants in El Salvador
summary: A deal freed 10 Americans and permanent U.S. residents detained in Venezuela, for more than 250 Venezuelans imprisoned in El Salvador after being expelled from the U.S.

title: To Staff Trump’s Immigration Crackdown, ICE Entices Its Retirees
summary: The administration is offering financial incentives to lure back recently departed immigration officers as it works to fill 10,000 job openings.

title: Stephen Colbert’s ‘Late Show’ Was Losing Millions at CBS Before Cancellation
summary: CBS could not figure out a path to profitability in an entertainment world increasingly dominated by streaming.

title: Lawmakers Question Whether CBS Canceled Colbert’s Show for Political Reasons
summary: Paramount, the network’s parent, recently agreed to pay President Trump $16 million to settle his lawsuit over the editing of an interview on the CBS News program “60 Minutes.”

title: Why Is Stephen Colbert’s ‘Late Show’ Getting Canceled?
summary: Maybe the “Late Show” decision is purely financial. But after Paramount’s cave over “60 Minutes,” it is hard to trust.

title: A Brief History of CBS’s Late-Night Eras
summary: With the hosts Merv Griffin, Pat Sajak, David Letterman and Stephen Colbert, CBS has taken many runs at late-night TV. Some were more successful than others.

title: Rubio Restricts U.S. Criticism of Tainted Foreign Elections
summary: A State Department cable telling officials to avoid comments on the “fairness or integrity” of most elections continues a U.S. turn away from promoting democratic values abroad.

title: E.P.A. Says It Will Eliminate Its Scientific Research Arm
summary: The decision comes after a Supreme Court ruling allowing the Trump administration to slash the federal work force and dismantle agencies.

title: Gabbard Claims Obama Administration Tried to Undermine Trump in 2016
summary: Democrats denounced a report issued by the Office of the Director of National Intelligence as politically motivated and error-ridden.

title: White House to Release $1.3 Billion in Frozen Funds for After-School Programs
summary: The money will allow federally funded after-school programs to open this school year, preserving a lifeline for working parents. But other federal dollars remain on hold.

title: Explosion at Los Angeles Training Center Kills 3 Sheriff’s Deputies
summary: It was not immediately clear what caused the blast at the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department’s Biscailuz Training Academy center. No one else was injured, officials said.

title: Mamdani Meets Jeffries in Brooklyn as He Seeks to Expand His Coalition
summary: No endorsement emerged from the meeting between Zohran Mamdani and Representative Hakeem Jeffries, but both said the gathering had been productive.

title: How a Video Studio Embraced A.I. and Stormed the Internet
summary: The Dor Brothers are indie filmmakers whose viral videos are generated entirely by artificial intelligence.

title: ‘A Chorus Line’ and ‘Chicago’ at 50: Who Won?
summary: The slinky jailbirds and Broadway hopefuls in these two classic shows have been fighting it out since 1975.

title: The Moves That Make ‘Chicago’ and ‘A Chorus Line’ So Special
summary: To celebrate the shows’ golden anniversaries, the Broadway star Robyn Hurder demonstrates what makes their choreography so special.

title: Felix Baumgartner, Skydiver Who Jumped From the Edge of Space, Dies Paragliding at 56
summary: Nicknamed “Fearless Felix,” he jumped from the edge of space in 2012.

title: Why Trump Can’t Shake Jeffrey Epstein
summary: The journalist Will Sommer examines the perfect storm of the Epstein files, Trump, QAnon and MAGA.

title: Stephen Colbert Could Never Save Us From Trump
summary: Mocking Donald Trump will not destroy him.

title: Trump Asked a Court to Unseal Epstein Grand Jury Testimony
summary: Also, Americans were released in a prisoner swap with Venezuela. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: NY Agrees to Settle Ex-Cuomo Aide’s Harassment Claims for $450,000
summary: The former executive aide, Brittany Commisso, accused Andrew M. Cuomo of groping her when he was governor. The state did not admit wrongdoing.

title: Minnesota State Senator Found Guilty in Burglary Trial
summary: Nicole Mitchell, a Democrat, was charged with felonies and accused of breaking into her stepmother’s home. Her party holds a slim majority in the Minnesota Senate.

title: Teen Charged With Murder in Killing of Paddleboarder in Maine
summary: Sunshine Stewart, 48, was found dead near 100 Acre Island after disappearing while paddle boarding in Union, Maine.
